content.description: The diagram represents a mixture that results when samples of <math alttext="C l 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> are combined and react, producing <math alttext="H C l, gas" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCl</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.
content.question: Which of the following identifies the limiting reactant and provides the best justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>, because there is unreacted <math alttext="H 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math> present.

<math alttext="H 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>, because it has a smaller molar mass than <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

<math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because there is no unreacted <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> present.

<math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because it has a larger molar mass than <math alttext="H 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because there is no unreacted <math alttext="C l 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> present.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
